text: The Myanma Investment and Commercial Bank (; abbreviated MICB) is a state- owned bank. MICB has branches mainly in Yangon and Mandalay and focuses primarily on business and domestic currency-denominated loans for commercial, investment, and development activities. MFTB also manages Burma's official foreign currency reserves. MICB also acts as a banking intermediary for foreign investment activities. The bank was established under the Financial Institutions of Myanmar Law of 1990, which separated the bank from Myanma Economic Bank. ==References== Category:Banks of Myanmar Category:Banks established in 1990 Category:1990 establishments in Myanmar Category:Yangon
title: Myanma Investment and Commercial Bank
